intro: Tragia giardelliae, commonly known as the Giardelli's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which is characterized by the presence of latex and unique floral structures. Tragia giardelliae is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
